StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertHSCCOnDemandVisitCard]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@SchoolCodeGUID uniqueiden..er = NULL, @SchoolYear int = NULL, @recuiterGuid uniqueiden..er = null
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
DECLARE @intErrorCode INT /****************************************************************** *** Get the Integer school Code from the given GUID param ********************************************************************/ declare @School_Code int SET @School_code = (SELECT school_code FROM [MCRISS].[dbo].High_School WHERE HIGH_SCHOOL.rowguid = @SchoolCodeGUID) PRINT @school_code
-- Gets current user declare @user_login varchar(15) set @user_login = (select current_user)
/*********************************************************** *** STEP 2 Insert new record for: HS Visit Card ***********************************************************/ IF NOT EXISTS(SELECT School_Code, School_Year FROM RSSOSS.USMC.HSCCVisitCard WHERE School_Code = @School_Code AND School_Year = @SchoolYear) BEGIN -- if does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO RSSOSS.USMC.HSCCVisitCard ( ID, School_Code, School_Year, DatePrepared ) VALUES ( newid(), @School_Code, @SchoolYear, GetDate() ) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
